learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced level skills of assessment and treatment of the articular, muscular and neural system.
Demonstrate an understanding of risk management principles and ethical considerations in the safe and effective management of clients with sports injuries and musculoskeletal conditions.
Understand and explain the rationale for the selection of assessment and treatment techniques/plans for sports injuries and musculoskeletal conditions.
Understand and explain the evidence underpinning physiotherapy management to the client and the multi-discipinary health/sports team.
Review and synthesis the literature to understand and communicate underlying pathology, risk factors and management of common injuries among individuals who participate in sport and exercise.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess practical physiotherapy skills in a practical station exam. It will cover content delivered between March 2nd and March 12th.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess students understanding of course content in a case-based online written exam.

This assessment task is to be completed online. Inspera Assessment may be used for this assessment. Further details, including an introduction to Inspera functionality, practice opportunities, and where to go for support, will be provided via Blackboard during semester.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will select a sport and deliver an individual oral presentation that presents their analysis of a fundamental skill or movement which is a key component of the sport (i.e., a tennis serve, volleyball spike, rugby tackle, the eggbeater kick in water polo, etc…), and discusses the management of a specific injury typically associated with the task.

The oral presentations will be delivered online.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 3(23 Feb - 15 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy (Lectures and clinical discussion)

Students will listen to lectures and participate in interactive discussions on a range of topics of relevance to sports and exercise physiotherapy. These learning activities are undertaken in person on campus during weeks 2 and 3, and independently online is week 1.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Advanced Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy (Lectures and clinical discussion)
learning_activities.topic_description: Advanced Sports and Exercise Physiotherapy (Lectures and clinical discussion) Students will listen to lectures and participate in interactive discussions on a range of topics of relevance to sports and exercise physiotherapy. These learning activities are undertaken in person on campus during weeks 2 and 3, and independently online is week 1.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 11(23 Feb - 17 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Independent optional preparation)

Students have the option of reviewing and learning practical musculoskeletal and sports physiotherapy skills through online video instruction for preparation for their Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy Clinical Practice Intensive.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Independent optional preparation)
learning_activities.topic_description: Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Independent optional preparation) Students have the option of reviewing and learning practical musculoskeletal and sports physiotherapy skills through online video instruction for preparation for their Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy Clinical Practice Intensive.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(02 Mar - 31 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Clinical practical series)

Students will learn practical musculoskeletal, sports and exercise physiotherapy skills through in-class demonstration, feedback on handling and exercise prescription, and application to clinical cases. These learning activities are undertaken in person on campus throughout weeks 2, 3, 12 and 13 of Semester.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Clinical practical series)
learning_activities.topic_description: Advanced Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy (Clinical practical series) Students will learn practical musculoskeletal, sports and exercise physiotherapy skills through in-class demonstration, feedback on handling and exercise prescription, and application to clinical cases. These learning activities are undertaken in person on campus throughout weeks 2, 3, 12 and 13 of Semester.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 10(09 Mar - 10 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Sports Analysis Presentation Feedback Session

Staff will provide feedback on the planning and development of your sports analysis presentation during an online feedback session. Students should come to the session with any specific questions they have about their sports analysis presentation, and be prepared to discussion their progress to date. This session will not be recorded.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
